title: Dispatch Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Professional and straightforward interview with a likeable interviewer. Interview started on time and was efficient. I don't love the lack of transparency around wages, but I come from the West Coast where it is now commonplace for wages to be openly disclosed in the advertising.
Interview Questions: Most questions were around my availability. Otherwise discussion was about specifics of position.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It was scheduled in advance according to my availability. 
 It was well structured.  It started on time and ended on time.  Interviewers were well prepared and asked relevant questions. Questions were relevant to the position.
Interview Questions: Most questions regarding past experiences

title: Physician Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Spoke over the phone with another PA then met in person for a day of interviewing/shadowing with both advanced practice providers and physicians. Did not hear back from them after this point.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and simple. Although I was asked to complete some task days after my portal said not selected. I felt as if this was not ok and didn’t feel as if my time was valued.
Interview Questions: What could I bring to the team.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: it was through zoom, everything went smooth and they were super nice about everything. they were patient if i took a little to think about a question, they made me feel comfortable
Interview Questions:
What made you want to apply here?
Asked me scenarios
3 strengths 
3 weaknesses

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Usual interview questions about strengths and weaknesses. Not a hard interview by any means. All interviews are virtual right now, which is a plus. Know one thing they can remember you by. that was a question.
Interview Questions: What is your nursing superpower?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a panel of 3 nurse managers from different units  and they determined which unit opening would be a good fit. Very friendly and reasonable/expected questions. Left time for me to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions:
With the high burn out rate for nurses, especially new nurses, how will you stay resilient in such a trying field?

What is your "super (nurse) power"?

title: Registered Nurse (BSN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Actually one of the best interviews, being a new grad I was nervous and starting to get discouraged but management made me feel comfortable. The interview was over the phone due to Covid-19 but we still managed to have fun with it while getting to know one another.
Interview Questions: Why did I bring to the table?

title: Emergency Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done over the phone.  Very easy interview with questions about why I was looking into medicine as well about personal. The entire process was less than 30 minutes. No medical exam that needed to be done unlike other scribe positions I had to apply to.  Overall very easy interview process.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to be a scribe?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mission Health in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, first with the HCA recruiter then with the floor manager. Recruiter was helpful in narrowing down my interests and comparability with certain floors and easily scheduled me in to their calendars for the ensuing phone interview. It was a quick process because I think Mission really is incentivized to hire FT staff right now.
Interview Questions: What are your “nursing superpowers”?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Hard ridiculous questions, intimidating on purpose. Took forever to call me back in the first place and then won’t follow up for months. They are so slow at hiring it’s ridiculous
Interview Questions: What was the worst thing you’ve ever done at your job?

title: Rehabilitation Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: I got my interview by first being a volunteer for several months prior before the position became available. Quite Lengthy with lots of back round check and immunizations and training classes.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Hospice RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with supervisor of hospice program and we discussed the job I applied for, my experience and when I could start.  I have a later start date than they wanted so I agreed to call them back in December when I would be more ready to start.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with hospice?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Met with the recruitment team to ensure cultural fit.  They asked behavioral interviewing questions.  Then I met with the hiring manager and the recruiter for HR.  They reviewed the job description and asked if I had questions and if was I still interested in joining the team.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Monitor Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: As an internal transfer, the process was a lot faster than as an initial hire.  I had a brief phone interview explaining the position, & was offered a traditional interview. I got to meet the team and see where I would be working and was I formed of various responsibilities.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my goals for the future.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an online application and received a call back in about a week.  Interviewed with 2 managers, and received an offer within a week of that.  Smooth, intuitive process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in  five years?

title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mission Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy, went smoothly. Management hired me rather quickly. Positive environment. I just did not end up accepting this offer because of another job opening closer by. It was a good networking experience.
Interview Questions: They asked me if i had any questions

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by one of the nurse managers over Copestone.  We met one on one in a board room for twenty minutes where he asked me a list of questions.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to practice nursing in the mental health setting?

title: Practice Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fine. They seemed very desperate for employees. Didn’t go through company benefits because HCA was in the process of buying them and was expected  To change. P.s. since the interview all 3 managers that interviewed me have quit or been payed off.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult patient

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. She read my resume and recommendations in front of me and asked why I wanted the job. I was asked to describe my experience working with a challenging population.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Are you aware this is a low paying position?

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone the manager seemed really nice and explained the hospital and it’s direction for growth. I was very excited for the chance to interview with this hospital
Interview Questions: If I had any questions

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with various managers - not bad and they were all friendly. Multi-step interview process - have to interview with various people, not just one interview.  HR takes forever to on board once you are hired.
Interview Questions:
Strengths/weaknesses
how do you handle stress

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the interdisciplinary team and it was very collaborative. They flew me in from out of state and paid for flight and hotel accommodations. One of the main reasons I chose to work here.
Interview Questions: How do you work with a team

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Brief and non intimidating process. Hired within a week of interview. The interviewers were team leaders and made me feel very comfortable. The interview lasted about 30 mins and the interview questions were not hard
Interview Questions: What made me decide to apply at HCH

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled, and I met with two Directors.  The  tone of the interview was informal.  I had a very  negative candidate experience because after discussing how the HR group was increasing engagement with employees, no one from the organization bothered to respond to my thank you note or provide any feedback on the interview.   This is disrespectful and not at all indicative of the values they claimed to have.  At least I learned that this organization doesn't walk their talk early in the process.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Standout?

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I first did a phone interview with the hiring manager, followed by an in-person interview with the hiring manager, and then a week later did a group interview with other clinicians.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your familiarity with resources in the community.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The department I applied for called me but I wasn't available, never left a message and when I called the department no one knew who called. Went through a lot of phone calls around the hospital to find who called. Turned out they wanted to tell me to come in the day after. Wouldn't do a phone interview with me either when I said I'd be taking an exam the next day and couldn't come.
Interview Questions: Online interpersonal competency tests

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply for the position from the Mission website, you gets a notification of applying, you receive interview call from HR in few days for initial screening, they ask you for the HR interview date, you go for the interview, if selected receive notification call from HR.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for Mission?

title: Medical Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It consists of several exams: a written test (translation and medical terminology), an oral test (two situations in which you have to interpret) and an over-the-phone language assessment in both languages. The whole process takes 2-3 months.
Interview Questions:
Can you tell me about a time in which you made a mistake in any previous job and how you dealt with it?
Can you tell me about things that you didn't like about your previous jobs?

title: Manager, EMR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position within the new EMR  initiative st Mission health and was selected to complete an initial interview. The interview was a online, one-way video recorded interview in which I was given 5 questions -one at a time- and asked to record my responses. You are unable to review your videos and the hitting manager offers no feedback if you are not selected. I received an email from the talent consultant who simply said they were moving forward with other candidates. The questions asked in the video interview were very general in nature and did not related to the position. This was my first ever interaction with a one-way video interview and perhaps that is why I feel/felt uncomfortable with the process and lack of feedback/communication.
Interview Questions: Are you a glass half full or empty kind of person.

title: Executive Director Telehealth Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mission Health (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was contacted by a recruiting firm they hired. Interviewed by telephone and would set up a phone call with SVP. Did not get to that second step as they hired an internal applicant.Received an email from Mission Health HR, also a voice message from the recruiting firm.
Interview Questions: Why the interest in moving to another state for this position

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Mission Health (Dickson, TN)
Interview Descriptions: It was done via phone conference do to me being in a different state very detailed and informative. The person that interviewed me was very qualified ask appropriate questions for the position that I was applying for. She was able to answer all my questions about the company, and give me a general background of the company..
Interview Questions: They asked about my skills comma experience comma longevity as a nurse comma my likes and dislikes about the nursing field and I do.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight-forward and simple process.  In and out in less than 30 min.  I had an advantage due to a few friends that referred me to the manager but still felt the interview process was easier than most.  Mostly focused on how the system operates and what the expectations of me are.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Mission?  What experience do you have?  Where do you see yourself?  What equipment have you used before?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed August 3rd for the position. The interview went well, and I got a good idea of the position and its duties. I was told that the next part of the process would be to meet with the office manager as that was who I would've been working most closely with if I had been chosen for the position. The director of food & nutrition  informed me that I would be called the next day to schedule a time. I didn't hear back for quite some time. I called multiple times, and finally heard back. However, It wasn't until August 26th that I met with the office manager. The director told me I was in the top four candidates they were considering, and that they would be deciding by the next day, the 27th. The director told me to call him directly if I didn't hear back from HR.  I never received a call/email from HR, nor did the director who I interviewed with ever email me back, or call me back after I left a voicemail. After a great initial two interviews (albeit very far apart) I was disappointed that I had to find out I didn't get the job by checking my career portal daily to see if the status of the position had been updated to 'Reviewed; not selected'.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an unhappy employee?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a great process.  I met with all the other managers and discussed the job.  We went over my qualifications and what their expectations would be.
Interview Questions: What are you qualifications

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough, very friendly, pretty fun.  It was a give and take, and very professional.  She described the job thoroughly, including the rough parts, rather than just trying to sell the job.  I appreciated that. She invited a lot of questions from me, wanted to discuss strong points and weak points, and addressed weak points not as deal killers but strategized about how to address those.
Interview Questions: "What is a task you really enjoy doing?"

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: It's the first round phone interview. Questions are about the background and resume. It also includes some introductions of the projects they're working on. I asked questions about the actual working time, languages to use and whether working remotely is allowed or not.
Interview Questions:
1. What's your most proud project?
2. What's your least proud project?
3. What making contribution means to you?

title: Esecutive Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and welcoming.  They were very upfront with the expectations and the demands of the position.  I was able to meet 2 executives and a former support person that held the position I was interviewing for.  I felt very informed when I left the interview.  I believe the folks I interviewed with were intent on informing me of the good and the bad of the position.  It will help me make a decision about the position
Interview Questions: What would you say your previous employer would consider your downfall or shortcoming?

title: ER Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Intense, respectful, thorough. It took awhile to get an offer, but it is a large corporation. It's a tough job, they have to carefully screen their applicants. They supported me throughout my time there, and were thoughtful and approachable.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: VERY lengthy. Took 2-3 weeks, spoke with 7-10 people at varying times. Interviews range from relaxed to intense. Be prepared to answer every and/or any question possible regarding your position. First impressions are very important, professional dress is a must.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the Asheville area?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied on company site, got a call after 2 weeks, went for the interview. Great Manager. Interview went for 40 minutes, showed the facility had a professional experience. Busy facility, very organized, the staff I met were graduates and seem to enjoy working. Spoke to a few and got a positive message.
Interview Questions: How did you manage disputes with colleagues if any

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mission Health (Franklin, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was a long process with a lot of online form to fill out and it took well over a week to finish all the requirements, once i got the forms finished i went to the hospital and had to sit around for almost 25 minutes for the manger met with me, after words she showed me a quick look at the floor then i was done.
Interview Questions: Are you good with people

title: Laundry Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: very quick and easy they show a lot of interest in me , but it just don't seem like a good place to work at seem as if there are a lot of turn overs because of the manger.
Interview Questions: what are your goals?

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line, had several phone interviews that lasted hours, and two on-site interviews. To make a long story short, they offered me a job, I put my condo on the market, and then they stopped returning my calls. A week later, they sent an email saying they are rescinding the offer!
Interview Questions: Interview was lengthy with no questions relevant to the actual job.

title: Contract Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: a laborious and redundant process it should have been my first warning sign.  despite having 5 years more of experience they chose the other candidate because he would work for 10$ an hour less.  they came back in 2 months because he didn't work out.  this was in part due, i am sure, multiple layers of management from the hospital system that was intergrating them
Interview Questions: how many years of experience do you have?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager and floor supervisor very comfortable felt like I was just talking to friends. Then took a tour of the unit, everyone was friendly and welcoming even when it was clear they were having a very hectic day. It was quick and I was called with an offer within a couple of days. The HR process was the longest part (background check, drug and health screen)
Interview Questions: Tell us about your last employer? Tell us about a time when you had to act in a situation where there was a "gray area" with regard to policy?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Very frustrating and sloppy process. I got called for a 4 panel interview and was told that there were 3 other openings for this same position within the hospital system. I was called again to interview for this same position several weeks later, but at the main hospital. The director was 30 minutes late to the interview. He only briefly interviewed me for 15 minutes before leaving the entire interview when his phone rang. Another manager took over the interview. I learned several days later that I did not get this position. Almost a month and half later, this same director offers me this position. I turned it down.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
Tell us about your current job?
What would you bring to Mission?

title: Professional Non-Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one video and one in person, assessment and quick decision to hire, three weeks to complete background check and general orientation was every other Monday.   The offer was equitable for the area and the recruiter was helpful in answering my questions and was responsive in returning my calls and emails.
Interview Questions: What about you makes you the best candidate for the job?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was a New Grad so I interviewed for their New Grad Cohort. My main interview was a group interview with 5-7 managers. They each asked me a question. They offered time for me to ask my questions.
Interview Questions: What qualities could you bring to the floor as an RN ?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mission Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager & owner, it was easy going, straight to the point, and key notes were discussed. I was referred by a current employee at Mission & long time friend of mine, she also had nothing but positive & nice things to say about the company. They were professional in approach & sent via email an offer letter. The whole process got me excited about the agency in general, it was just a preview to one of the best jobs I'll ever have.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Mission Healthcare?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It took 3 months to actually start after being offered the job. HR is extremely slow and they are not good at calling you back when you have questions.

I did 3 phone interviews and then had to interview with every single supervisor which of course they couldn't all get together at once so I ended up coming to the hospital 3 more times to meet them and interview with them
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
Are you a team player?
How do you handle work place drama?
How would you handle it if there was a big snow storm and you had to work the next day.

title: Environmental Services Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Highlands, NC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process. You have to go through orientation and take alot of test on the computer and get all your shots up to date and turn in your medical records before you can even begin to work. The interview was pretty much straight forward. It was really easy not too long.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience?

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: You submit an application online and wait. If you are rejected, you don't get a phone call or a letter. Just a message on the job board. You may get a message that your application is being reviewed. This just means you made it through the scrubbers. If you are seriously being considered you won't know until you get a phone call. Then you set an interview time for a one to one or two to one or whatever the department deems appropriate.
Interview Questions: I didn't have any difficult questions. There was nothing to trip me up. It was more like, "This is entry level, you have a credential, you seem normal, you're hired."

title: Home Health RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: very relaxing but with competent people who knew about the role I was applying for. I was prepared for the type of questions: life experience more than nursing questions.  they expected I knew about nursing.  They wanted to see more about personality and professionalism.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with conflict at the workplace and how did you handle it.

title: Catering Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Done online. You create a profile, submit an application, submit a resume and cover letter, and they call you if they are interested. After they send you an email telling you that you have been selected and after they call you to verify your references and do a background check on you, they request you to take a drug test and a mini physical. They will also request a shot record. After that, they will tell you to come in for orientation and then you start your job... it took a month.
Interview Questions: All questions that were asked was done online. There was a lot.

title: Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Innovative interviewing techniques - online. I answered their questions via video recording. Must've done well on the recorded interview as they flew me in for an interview. When I got to the interview it was as if they never saw my initial interview as I referenced it several times and out of all the people I met with only one indicated they had seen it. I didn't actually get to speak with the person who supervises that position until I was on-site; if I had of spoken to that person over the phone or video link, I would've never flown on-site to meet. While the process was innovative it didn't allow for personal interaction and for me to decide if I wanted to work for this organization and leader until it was too late.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult or unexpected question(s). The person who supervises this position was hard to follow and know what they were asking.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I am a freshly registered Nurse.  I wanted to enter into Mission Health's New Nurse Graduate program.  Before anything I was instructed to take about 4 hours worth of testing which covered everything from personality and cognitive testing to comprehension of Med/Surg and Pharmacology as well as having 5 references fill out a reference form.  That's where my process ended, they didn't even want my resume.
Interview Questions: Having to take a personality test.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions:
I called and talked to the Director of the unit and set up an interview with her.
I met with the Director of the unit and was very impressed by her skill level and friendly attitude. She was appreciative of my past experience and willing to accomodate my full time schedule at another facility. This Director has since left the facility.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Performance Improvement QAII Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Department leader stretched very thin.  Took months to actually speak to him and eventually get a personal interview.  Interview process took months as well with three rounds of panel and individual interviews.
Interview Questions: What makes you tick?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mission Health
Interview Descriptions: Via internet. No reeply as of yet
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mission Health (Mission Viejo, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: They called me on a Thursday, wanting to set up an interview for the next day. We scheduled it and I came in the next day. They asked routine questions, about my previous job, my education, my strengths, my biggest challenge (weakness), how I work with a group etc. After the interview they said they would contact me for good or bad news after all interviews have been done.
Interview Questions: What did you not like about your old job?

title: Physician Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Heavily behavioral interviewing-focused. Standard open ended questions. Did not feel like it was personalized to draw out my training or experience. I was asked questions by three interviewers and it felt like not all were engaged in the process. It was a very regimented dialogue. I wish I would have been more attuned to this being a good indication of the company's culture and should have used this as my interview to evaluate them.
Interview Questions: Asked to describe a frustrating situation and to describe the outcome.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone calls and Skype sessions that never seemed to work. The questions were common "interview" questions: why do you want to work at Mission? What makes you a good candiate for this job? Describe your experience as a nurse? Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 10 years?
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Environmental Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mission Health (Asheville, NC) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Being the largest employer in WNC, it is extremely hard to land an interview at Mission.  Prior to this interview, I had been applying for years with no response.  I received a call from the Coordinator inviting me to the interview.  From there, it was all relatively easy.  We talked about my background, how hard it is to get into Mission, my goals, and she had me tell her what my interpretation was of the MERIT value system.
